intro: Astragalus antoninae, commonly known as the Antonina milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and supports local pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
